bug.author: pableeto
bug.summary: calling Trainer.test(model) will perform test twice
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When calling Trainer.test(model) after training separately, the Test routine will be called twice. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: <denchmark-code>model = my_lightning_model(some_hparams) trainer = Trainer() trainer.fit(model) trainer.test(model) #the test routine will be performed twice </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The test should be only performed once via trainer.test(model). <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch version: 1.4.0 Is debug build: No CUDA used to build PyTorch: 10.1 OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.5.0-3ubuntu1~18.04) 7.5.0 CMake version: version 3.10.2 Python version: 3.6 Is CUDA available: Yes CUDA runtime version: 10.1.243 GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti GPU 1: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Nvidia driver version: 430.14 cuDNN version: Could not collect Versions of relevant libraries: [pip3] numpy==1.18.1 [pip3] pytorch-lightning==0.6.1.dev0 [pip3] torch==1.4.0 [pip3] torchvision==0.5.0 [conda] Could not collect <denchmark-h:h3>Potential reason causing this bug</denchmark-h>
By dive into pl's source code, I found the reason might be related to pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py at line 1104 & line 1177: line 1104: <denchmark-code> # when testing requested only run test and return if self.testing: # only load test dataloader for testing self.reset_test_dataloader(ref_model) self.run_evaluation(test_mode=True) return </denchmark-code>
line 1177: <denchmark-code> self.testing = True if model is not None: self.fit(model) self.run_evaluation(test_mode=True) </denchmark-code>
When calling trainer.test(model) at line 1177, self.testing will be set to True; since model is not None, self.fit(model) will be called; then in line 1104 at fit(), self.testing is True, so the self.run_evaluation will be called first time. After that, the self.run_evaluation in test() (as in line 1180) will be called again, thus result in twice test evulation. <denchmark-h:h3>Potential fix</denchmark-h>
change the code snippet in test() to <denchmark-code> self.testing = True if model is not None: #as self.testing = True, self.fit(model) will only perform test self.fit(model) else: #if model is not None, then the test has been already performed in fit() self.run_evaluation(test_mode=True) </denchmark-code>
might fix the problem? P.S. if possible, I'd be happy to submit a PR on this :)
